summary: During the COVID-19 pandemic, agencies swiftly distributed funds and started programs to help businesses and workers. But this speed came with a greater risk of payments that shouldn't have been made or were for incorrect amounts. The Small Business Administration provided over $1 trillion in loans and grants, and the Labor Department spent $900 billion on unemployment insurance. We looked at how these agencies identify...
title: COVID-19 Relief: SBA and DOL Should Improve Processes to Identify and Recover Overpayments
